qas.question: What do Muslims call the month when they fast between sunup and sundown?
What would DST delay if observed during the Muslim holy month?
What Muslim country continues to observe DST during Ramadan?

context: In some Muslim countries DST is temporarily abandoned during <a0_0>Ramadan<a0_0/> (the month when no food should be eaten between sunrise and sunset), since the DST would delay <a1_0>the evening dinner<a1_0/>. Ramadan took place in <a3_0>July and August<a3_0/> in 2012. This concerns at least Morocco and Palestine, although <a2_0>Iran<a2_0/> keeps DST during Ramadan. Most Muslim countries do not use DST, partially for this reason.
